page.title: 05Ryde Pier
page.content: The pier is really two separate piers.They are about 700 metres long. The Eastern part carries a two track, standard gauge railway line with a station at the head of the pier.One of the tracks is used for a shuttle train which goes from the boats to the Esplanade where there is a bus station. The other is used by trains running through to the resorts of Sandown and Shanklin where the line now ends. The other part of the pier has a wooden surface and cars use this to drive up to the pierhead to meet passengers or to park. There used to be a tram running between these two parts of the pier but this is now closed. Fishermen use the pier.
